intro: Warszewiczia ambigua, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and spiny leaves. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various animals.
